title: Bug 19651: Team menu disappears from Hierarchy and Packages view
description: The team menu is missing from the TestClass in the package view.
OB: The team menu is not there anymore in the TestClass popup menu in the package view.
EB: The team menu should be displayed in the TestClass popup menu in the package view.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Open Eclipse with a new workspace.
2) Switch to the Java perspective and close the resource perspective.
3) Create a Java Project named 'TestProject'.
4) Create a Java class named 'TestClass'.
5) Paste the provided code in the TestClass and save it.
6) Change the preference 'WorkbenchPerspective' to open the perspective in a new window.
7) Change the preference 'Java' to 'Open a new Type Hierarchy Perspective'.
8) Exit the workbench and restart it.
9) Select the TestClass (the class, not the unit) in the package view and open the popup menu.
10) The team menu should be visible but disabled.
11) Exit the workbench and restart it again.
12) Select the word 'InnerClass' in the text editor and press F4.
13) Open the popup menu on the new hierarchy view.
14) The team menu should not be displayed, which is expected for inner classes.
15) Select the word 'TestClass' in the new text editor and press F4.
16) The team menu should be displayed, but it is not.
17) Close the two new windows.
18) Select the TestClass in the package view and open the popup menu.
19) The team menu is not there anymore.
